bug.short_desc: [abrt] lftp: Log::WillOutput(): lftp killed by SIGSEGV

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Any invocation of lftp results in a crash.
Version-Release number of selected component: lftp-4.6.5-3.fc24
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.6.4 backtrace_rating: 4 cmdline: lftp sftp://rosebud crash_function: Log::WillOutput executable: /usr/bin/lftp global_pid: 1902 kernel: 4.5.0-300.fc24.x86_64 runlevel: N 5 type: CCpp uid: 1000
Truncated backtrace: Thread no. 1 (10 frames) #0 Log::WillOutput at log.cc:47 #1 Log::Format at log.cc:108 #2 NumberPair::Set at ResMgr.cc:716 #3 NumberPair::init at ResMgr.cc:671 #4 NumberPair::NumberPair at ResMgr.h:205 #5 ResMgr::UNumberPairValidate at ResMgr.cc:867 #6 ResType::ClassInit at resource.cc:423 #7 FileAccess::ClassInit at FileAccess.cc:1067 #8 FileAccess::Init at FileAccess.cc:51 #9 FileAccess::FileAccess at FileAccess.h:268
Potential duplicate: bug 1312915
lftp-4.6.5-3.fc24.x86_64 does for me consistently "segmentation violation" on every try but lftp-4.7.0-1.fc25.x86_64 from koji runs so far without any issues.

Hi,
I know about the segfault in 4.6.5, but it was fixed by upgrading to 4.7.0 in RAWHIDE and F24. If you experience any issue with 4.6.5, please update to the latest version.
